required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Marginal Integrity Using Bioactive Cement Incementation of Indirect Composite Blocks
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Marginal Integrity Using Modified USPHS Criteria of a Bioactive Cement in Comparison to Resin Cement in Cementation of Indirect Composite Blocks: A Randomized Clinical Trial 12 Month Follow up

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate of marginal integrity of indirect composite restoration after cementation by a bioactive cement in comparison to dual cure resin cement using Modified USPHS criteria

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be conducted in Conservative Dentistry Department, Faculty of Dentistry, Cairo University, The operator in charge will be: Mohamed Sherif . The researcher will bear ultimate responsibility for all activities associated with the conduct of a research project including recruitment of patients, explaining and performing the procedures to them,A total of 36 volunteer patients with Patients with badly broken vital teeth with minimum of two remaining walls. Patients will be randomly divided into two groups according to type of cement (S) where in group S1, Restoration will be cemented with resin cement ; while group S2,Restoration will be cemented with active cement. Each restoration will be assessed after three, six months and one year using modified USPH Criteria Marginal Discoloration, Recurrent Caries and Marginal Chipping with scale of Alpha and non alpha

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 36 volunteer assigned randomly into 2 equal groups of 18
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Check Marginal Discoloration Using Modified USPH criteria

arm_group.description: Intervention Group Using active cement bio activa

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with badly broken vital teeth with minimum of two remaining walls
- Adult Males or female 16- 65 years old
- Good oral hygiene measures with a good gingival condition
- Cooperative patients approving to participate in the study
- Free of any medical condition that interfere with procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a compromised medical history.
- Severe or active periodontal disease
- Endodontically treated teeth
- Severe medical complications Lack of compliance

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual patient Data can be shared Upon request
